p: Commercially available carboxylated multiwalled carbon nanotubes (COOH-MWCNTs) [ 142], have been employed by Tan et al. [ 143] to covalently conjugate SIL for the advanced drug delivery in therapeutic applications. Drug release from the carbon nanotubes showed a sustained and pH dependent behaviour while a significant in vitro cytotoxicity was expressed against two human cancer cell lines at lower concentrations of 1.56–6.25 μg/mL when compared to free drug alone.
